column1: NGR is BWLCH TOMLYD at the stated altitude. The records were taken by the British Rainfall Organisation with named observers being G Symons and his successors. The 1920s records has a relationship with church and station consistent with this NGR and the 1925 description of the terrain broadly matches. The 1930s record has a lower altitude and much larger distances to the same church and station implying a gauge move of many miles. The 1940s records casts doubt on the lower altitude but does not includes relationships with church. There is no mention of a move in the records.
Many readings are combined readings for 2 or 3 months and there are also many estimated readings
